description:
Global Product Partnerships (GPP) negotiates and manages Content Partnerships (e.g., data licensing agreements) and Actions Integrations (e.g., collaborations to let users “do things” like reserve a table). These partnerships build and differentiate Google’s products in areas including Search, Assistant, Geo (Maps, Local), News & Publishing, Research & Machine Intelligence, as well as Chrome/Web, Developer Products, Identity, and Lens.

Strategy and Operations (StratOps) plays a critical role in driving strategy and execution for GPP. We focus on delivering thought leadership, operational efficiency, and executive-level narratives to advance GPP and Google’s product mission. We work directly with GPP leaders on priority topics across all product areas and help the global organization identify, plan for, and execute against their highest priorities.

As a member of GPP StratOps, you are passionate about Google products, and the partnerships that help build these products. You thrive in a fast-paced, high intensity, and rapidly evolving environment. You are a critical thinker, able to step back and see the big picture. You are an expert at turning complex topics into simple executive level narratives. You able to operate effectively in highly ambiguous settings. You want to be part of a growing team that is building a long-term product partnerships focused strategy and operations capability.

You're a strong strategy and operations practitioner to support Search Product Partnerships. You'll partner closely with the Global Director of Search Product Partnerships to identify, prioritize, and execute initiatives that help enable GPP’s strategic partnerships and business development efforts in Search. You'll be a thought partner as well as an advocate and challenger for the GPP Search team.

Google’s Global Partnerships team powers extraordinary user experiences through meaningful partnerships. We build relationships that solve users’ needs, advance our partners’ goals, and further Google’s mission. Our team provides solutions for a range of partners — from helping publishers and developers grow their businesses through monetization solutions, to helping our long-term partners anticipate and navigate change in a way that delivers economic and reputational value. We build and distribute Google products through partnerships across a multitude of product areas, including Search, Assistant, Geo, News, Travel, and more. We collaborate across Google, ensuring a coordinated approach when engaging with our most complex and strategic partners.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • 5 years of management consulting, investment banking, corp strategy, or equivalent experience
  • Communication, interpersonal, and presentation experience.
  • Analytical, problem solving, and quantitative modeling experience.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 10 years of experience at a management consulting firm, corporate strategy team, or investment bank.
  • Strong operations background and experience in a large/global organization.
  • Experience in technology and emerging/early stage products.
responsibilities:
• Provide day-to-day strategy and operations support to the GPP Search team.
  • Deliver thought leadership and strategic guidance Search specific topics and collaborate with the broader GPP StratOps team and other GPP Leads on x-product area (e.g., Actions on Google) efforts.
  • Build consensus and alignment across GPP Search Global and Region teams, as well as critical cross-functional stakeholders in Search product, gTech, and Global Business Organization frontline teams (e.g., Large Customer Sales, Large Partner Solutions).
  • Drive operational efficiency with GPP Search team to support execution of the highest priority product-enabling partnership goals, including but not limit to project prioritization, resource planning and allocation, and cross-functional coordination.
title: Strategy and Operations Lead, Search, Global Product Partnerships
